title: How to Clean Joy Con Buttons

steps.title: Power off the console before cleaning the controller.
steps.content: Power off the console before cleaning the controller. This prevents you from accidentally selecting something while you’re cleaning the controller. Hold the power button on top of the Switch for 5 seconds. When the power menu appears on the screen, press "Power Options" and then "Turn Off." [1] X Research source Removing dirt and dust from the buttons could fix response problems or sticking. Try to clean out the button spaces before using another cleaning methods.

steps.title: Dig out dirt around the buttons with a toothpick.
steps.content: Dig out dirt around the buttons with a toothpick. Dirt and dust build up in the small spaces around the buttons over time. Start by manually removing as much as you can with a toothpick. Insert the tip and scrape upward to pull out and dirt. [2] X Research source You can do this around the joysticks too. This could improve playability. If you don't have a toothpick, other thin items like a pin or paperclip could also work. As long as they're small enough to fit into the space around the buttons then they'll work. Don’t bend the toothpick while you’re cleaning or you could break it off in the space.

steps.title: Scrub around the buttons with a dry, soft toothbrush.
steps.content: Scrub around the buttons with a dry, soft toothbrush. This helps pull up any remaining dirt that you couldn’t get with the toothpick. Use a dry, soft-bristled toothbrush and insert the bristles into the space around the buttons. Scrub around each button in circular motion to pull out more dirt. [3] X Research source To make sure the toothbrush is completely dry, use a fresh one that’s never been used.

steps.title: Wipe up any remaining dust on the controller with a microfiber cloth.
steps.content: Wipe up any remaining dust on the controller with a microfiber cloth. Pulling the dust out of the buttons will probably leave some on the controller body. Give the controller a thorough wipe down with a microfiber cloth to get rid of these leftovers. [4] X Research source You could also use a cotton swab or soft rag to do this. Don’t use paper towels or tissues, because these could leave paper remnants behind.

steps.title: Dip a cotton swab into rubbing alcohol.
steps.content: Dip a cotton swab into rubbing alcohol. This trick works for unsticking buttons, and also simple disinfection of your controller. Pour a bit of rubbing alcohol into a small cup. Dip the head of a cotton swab in and shake it a bit so it isn’t dripping. [5] X Research source Be advised that Nintendo doesn’t recommend using cleaners on Joy-Cons because the plastic can fade. However, there’s no warning that the controller won’t work anymore, so if you don’t mind the color fading a bit, then this method is fine. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Rub the alcohol around each button.
steps.content: Rub the alcohol around each button. Take the cotton swab and press it against the end of a button. Make a circle around the button to clean it. This helps remove dirt buildup that could make the button stick. [7] X Research source The cotton swab won't fit into the space around the buttons, so don't try to insert it. Just rub the controller surface and button border. If you’re having trouble with one button that’s sticking, you could focus on that one. For a general clean, wipe around all the buttons. You can also rub around the joysticks.

steps.title: Wipe the rest of the controller with alcohol to disinfect the whole thing.
steps.content: Wipe the rest of the controller with alcohol to disinfect the whole thing. Pour some alcohol on a cotton ball or microfiber cloth. Then wipe down the entire controller surface, along with the buttons and joystick tops. This disinfects the entire thing and prevents you or your friends from getting sick. [8] X Research source Cleaning after a lot of people use your controllers, like if you have a party, is a good idea. This removes any germs that your controllers picked up from other people.

steps.title: Dry off all the areas you rubbed alcohol on.
steps.content: Dry off all the areas you rubbed alcohol on. The alcohol will evaporate on its own, but drying the controller off could prevent some of the discoloration that alcohol could cause. Use a microfiber cloth or cotton ball and rub all the areas that you wiped alcohol on to remove the moisture. [9] X Research source Don’t use a paper towel or tissue, because these could leave paper remnants behind.
